messages: b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (10:50): mozilla landed initial <video> support yesterday, it seems
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (10:50): though not turned on by default
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:02): http://standardssuck.org/the-test-suite-is-not-enough
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:11): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, this NodeList.toArray() seems like something for DOM5, not HTML5 http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=5851
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:12): but it's definitely needed. I think i suggested it somewhere once too, or if not, I know I at least thought about it.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:12): yeah I just wanted to turn one of my e-mails into something more specific
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:12): (originally i just had an e-mail saying "look at this blog entry")
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:12): (but that was the only thing actionable from that list)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:13): i wish webidl (heycam) and dom core (zcorpan) and other specs (lachy, edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e) used bugzilla
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:14): then i could bounce these bugs to other people and know they were not lost
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:14): sure, that could work.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:15): I'll speak to chaals about setting up a webapps product and then you can move all the stuff to that and assign to the right person.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:15): that would be sweet
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:16): I just don't know when I'll be able to speak to him, I don't know where he is and he still hasn't responded to a mail I sent him last week
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:18): just post it to the public-webapps list and have mike or doug do it :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:18): i'm sure chaals wouldn't mind, it's not like it affects the group really
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:19): it's up to the editors how they track issues, after all
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:19): ok, maybe later.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:19): I gotta get ready and go to work now
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (11:21): looks public-html-bugzilla hasn't recieved new posts for a while
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (11:21): oh, no, that's just me looking at the June archive page
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (11:21): I do that every month change
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (11:22): "man, traffic sure died down"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:22): use /latest as your bookmark
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:22): bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2, just bookmark /public-html-bugzilla/latest and you don't have the problem
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (11:22): I don't use bookmarks, I keep open tabs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:22): wow, my browsers aren't stable enough for that
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:22): or just keep that in your autocomplete history then
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:22): uses http://‚ò?.damowmow.com/
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:23): bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2, how many tabs do you keep open?
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (11:23): Want me to count?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:23): just a rough guess
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:23): i wonder how long i should wait for microsoft to get back to me on their needs for workers
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (11:24): 12+41+10 over three opera windows, and five in firefox
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:24): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, knowing MS, you could be waiting months.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:24): woah. I hate having more than 6, and when I get to about 10 I start closing old ones
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:25): how do you find anything efficiently with that many tabs?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:25): then I'd have to create a W3C bugzilla account
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (11:25): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: window panel
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:25): If I want to look at a page again, I just start typing it's url or, if I can't remember that, something from the title and it shows up quickly enough
